meta.description: SIMPLIFIED BEST PRACTICES - Modify this file only. Rules are auto-generated to rules/ directory.
meta.instructions: Edit rules below, then run: npm run generate:rules

rules.title: Use Meaningful Variable Names
rules.recommendation: Use descriptive names for variables, functions, and components. Avoid single letters (except i, j in loops).

codeExample.bad: const x = getData(); const a = x.filter(u => u.age > 18);
codeExample.good: const users = getData(); const adults = users.filter(user => user.age > 18);

rules.title: Proper Error Handling
rules.recommendation: Always catch and handle errors gracefully. Provide meaningful error messages to users.

codeExample.good: try { const data = fetchData(); } catch (error) { console.error('Failed:', error); }

rules.title: Component Composition
rules.recommendation: Break large components into smaller, reusable components. Avoid prop drilling.

codeExample.good: // Split into UserHeader, UserContent, UserFooter components

rules.title: Prefer const and let over var
rules.recommendation: Use const by default, let when needed, avoid var (which has function scope issues).

codeExample.good: const count = 0; // or let if it changes

rules.title: Avoid Prop Drilling
rules.recommendation: Use Context API or state management for deeply nested props. Don't pass props through many levels.

codeExample.bad: // Passing through 5 component levels just to reach one child

rules.title: Test Coverage
rules.recommendation: Write tests for critical functions and components. Aim for at least 80% coverage.

codeExample.good: // Write unit and integration tests using Jest/Vitest

rules.title: Code Documentation
rules.recommendation: Document complex functions, components, and modules. Use JSDoc comments.

codeExample.bad: function process(x, y) { return x + y; }
codeExample.good: /** Adds two numbers. @param {number} x @param {number} y @returns {number} */ function add(x, y) { return x + y; }

rules.title: Avoid Deep Nesting
rules.recommendation: Keep code nesting at 3 levels or less. Use early returns to reduce nesting.

rules.title: Don't Repeat Yourself (DRY)
rules.recommendation: Extract duplicate code into reusable functions or components.

codeExample.bad: // Same validation logic in 5 different places

rules.title: Use React Hooks Properly
rules.recommendation: Use functional components with hooks instead of class components.

rules.title: Handle Loading and Error States
rules.recommendation: Always handle loading, error, and empty states in your components.

codeExample.bad: // Just showing data without handling loading/error
codeExample.good: // Show spinner when loading, error message on failure, empty state if no data

rules.title: Use React.memo for Performance
rules.recommendation: Wrap expensive components with React.memo to prevent unnecessary re-renders.

rules.title: Code Splitting
rules.recommendation: Use dynamic imports for large features to reduce initial bundle size.

rules.title: Lazy Load Images
rules.recommendation: Use lazy loading for images below the fold. Use responsive images.

rules.title: Use Next.js Image Component
rules.recommendation: Use next/image instead of for automatic optimization.

rules.title: Monitor Bundle Size
rules.recommendation: Regularly check bundle size. Keep it under 100KB for initial load.

rules.title: Add Alt Text to Images
rules.recommendation: Every image must have meaningful alt text for screen readers.

rules.title: Keyboard Navigation
rules.recommendation: Ensure all interactive elements are accessible via keyboard (Tab, Enter, Space).

codeExample.good: <button onClick={handleClick}>Click me</button> // Has built-in keyboard support

rules.title: Use Semantic HTML
rules.recommendation: Use semantic HTML tags (button, nav, main, article) instead of generic divs.

rules.title: ARIA Labels for Complex Components
rules.recommendation: Use aria-label, aria-labelledby for non-standard components.

rules.title: Color Contrast
rules.recommendation: Ensure text has sufficient contrast ratio (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).

codeExample.bad: // Light gray text on white background
codeExample.good: // Dark text on light background or light text on dark background

rules.title: Meta Tags for SEO
rules.recommendation: Add meaningful title, description, and OpenGraph tags for better SEO.

rules.title: Structured Data
rules.recommendation: Use JSON-LD for structured data to help search engines understand content.
